intro: Exostema parviflorum subsp. maestrense, commonly known as the Maestrense Exostema, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent-like stems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
